title: 11.1 News - tto123
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollectie voor Engels voor tweetalig onderwijs, leerjaar 1,2 en 3. Dit is thema 11 'Press and media'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: News. In deze les staat nieuws centraal, waarbij er gekeken wordt op welke manier men nieuws kan krijgen (bijv. televisie of krant) en hoe men een krantenkop en -artikel kan lezen. In de grammaticaopdracht wordt de present perfect behandeld.

items.content:
The subject of this double period is the news.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

A game
You are going to play a game and the person with the highest score wins.
You are going to write a word web about the subject "news".

  • Write down the word 'news' in the middle of a sheet of paper.
  • Take 2 minutes on your own to write down as many English words related to "news".
  • Compare your word webs and score points.

Scoring points
2 points For each word the other group members didn't have.
1 point For each word only 1 other group member has got.
0 points For each word you all wrote down.

Step Activity Aim Time
introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1 Listening
Where people get news		 You can understand people who talk about getting news and answer questions about them. 15
Step 2 Reading
Headlines		 You can understand headlines and a text and answer questions about it. 15
Step 3 Vocabulary You can understand and use vocabulary about the news. 15
Step 4 Grammar
Present perfect and past simple		 You can understand and use the present perfect and past simple. 15
Step 5 Speaking
Crazy headlines		 You can have a discussion about crazy headlines. 10
Step 6 Writing
Headline writing		 You can write headlines and an article. 15
Step 7 Evaluation Reflect on what you have learnt. 05
Step 8 Extra
Talking about the News		 Watch the video.

Where people get news
You are going to listen to six people who tell where they get the news.

  • Listen to the recording and do assignment 1.
  • Listen again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Copy and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

How do these people get their news?

Extra information

Speaker 1

Speaker 2

Speaker 3

Speaker 4

Speaker 5

Speaker 6

header.title: Where do people get their news?

prompt.body: How does speaker 1 get his news?
How does speaker 2 get his news?
How does speaker 3 get his news?
How does speaker 4 get her news?
How does speaker 5 get his news?
How does speaker 6 get his news?

items.content:
Headlines
You are going to read some English headlines and an acticle.

  • Do assignment 1
  • Choose an article to read.
  • Do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Read the following headlines and discuss what you think the articles are about.

  • A cat called Tiger stops the post
  • The day I flew to Britain with a corpse
  • Jose Mujica: The world's 'poorest' president
  • Armstrong the Good Giraffe speaks about his acts of kindness
  • How surgery for pets can save human lives

Choose an article
You have read the headlines, now make a choice of which article you are going to read.
Ask your teacher how many articles you have to read. Don't forget to make a list of difficult words.

• A cat called Tiger stops the post
  • The day I flew to Britain with a corpse
  • Jose Mujica: The world's 'poorest' president
  • Armstrong The Good Giraffe speaks about his acts of kindness
  • How surgery for pets can save human lives

Assignment 2

Copy and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

Title

Who

Where

What

Why

When

• Study the vocabulary. (10 minutes)
  • Do the exercise.

Vocabularylist News

content.body:
Fill in the correct word.
Choose from: article - collect her mail - deliveries - dressed up as - employee - listens to the radio - local sorting office - magazine - main - news stories - postal worker - reading the newspaper - resume

  1. My uncle works at the .
  2. He has been an of the Royal Mail since he started work.
  3. I never want to be a .
  4. What is your source of news?
  5. My dad is always as soon as it is delivered.
  6. My mum all day long, especially Classic FM.
  7. I read an about dead bodies on a plane.
  8. At the party I was Dr Who.
  9. The Economist is not my favourite .
  10. I like to read about famous people.

items.content:
Past simple en present perfect
Do you remember them? The past simple and present perfect?
Have a look at the Knowledge base 'past simple' and 'present perfect' to revise them.
Present perfect
Simple past

Now try the following Assignments.
If you like to practise with an extra assignment: Multiple-choice exercise

content.body:
Has the past simple been used correctly or incorrectly in the following sentences?

We found the book you asked for. Correct Incorrect
Did Sarah ate too much yesterday? Correct Incorrect
My brother took a shower. Correct Incorrect
My boyfriend maked my bike yesterday. Correct Incorrect
Did he made your bike yesterday? Correct Incorrect
George left the building a few minutes a go. Correct Incorrect
Did George met Daphne yesterday? Correct Incorrect
He didn't knew the answer? Correct Incorrect
Did Harry walk to school? Correct Incorrect
He went to school by bike. Correct Incorrect
Did they drank a cup of tea? Correct Incorrect
She sang a beautiful song yesterday. Correct Incorrect
He writed a book last year? Correct Incorrect
Daphne bought new shoes yesterday. Correct Incorrect

prompt.body:
Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
He ..... hard yesterday.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
He ..... football for 5 years, but nowadays he plays hockey.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
He ..... in Amsterdam for 2 years and he still likes it there.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
I ..... her since 1980 and we still see each other every week.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
He ..... a letter to his girlfriend last week.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
The Titanic ..... in 1912.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
He ..... when his girlfriend left him, but he's OK now.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
Sarah ..... bacon in her life! She is a true vegetarian.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
I ..... these boots to go hiking yesterday.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
I ..... my binder yesterday, but my brother found it this morning.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
The children ..... all the orange juice! We'll need to get some more.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
We ..... this TV set since 1988, and it still works.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
This wine ..... in the cellar for 15 years. When we take it out and open it, it will taste beautiful.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
I ..... some new shorts, but I don't think I like them. Maybe I'll take them back to the store.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
Somebody ..... my bicycle! Now I'll have to walk home.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
I ..... Michael for 3 days.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
Gerry ..... off his bike three times this month.

Choose the correct form of the verb in the following sentence.
Ouch! I ..... my finger!

items.content:
Situation 2: Crazy headlines

Writing headlines is difficult! You must try to give as much information as possible in just one line.
Moreover, the line must be interesting and capture (=trekken) people's attention.
This exercise shows that headline writing is not easy.
Something went wrong writing them.

Work together with a classmate and discuss what is wrong or strange about the following headlines.
Use www.macmillandictionary.com if you need a dictionary.

HEADLINES:

  • Something Went Wrong in Jet Crash, Expert Says
  • Typhoon Rips Through Cemetery; Hundreds Dead
  • Local High School Dropouts Cut in Half
  • Blind Woman Gets New Kidney from Dad She Hasn't Seen in Years

Headline writing

Assignment 1

Write an interesting headline for the following two pictures.

Assignment 2

Pictures sometimes say more than words.

  • Look for a picture you find beautiful and/or shocking and/or interesting.
    (tip: try searching for 'World Press Photo').
  • Write a small newspaper article to go with your picture.

Ask your teacher how many words you have to use.

What have you learnt in this period?
Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • What do you have to ask your teacher?

Talking about the news

How do people consume news in the digital age? Watch the discussion between Lawrence and Charlotte. Turn on the subtitles if it helps you understand better.

  • Watch the video.
  • What do Lawrence and Charlotte say about fake news?
